title: VNC connections close on their own after unspecified amount of time
author: dezryth
body_snippet:
<!-- Bug -->
|||
|--:|---|
|Operating system | Windows 10 x64 |
|mRemoteNG version| 1.75.7008.17907  |

After opening a connection with VNC, the connection closes after a random amount of time. Usually within a minute or two. I receive the following in my logs:

System.EventArgs
2017-08-11 16:59:14,989 [1] ERROR- Protocol Event Disconnected failed.
{0}
   at mRemoteNG.Connection.ConnectionInitiator.Prot_Event_Disconnected(Object sender, String disconnectedMessage)
2017-08-11 16:59:15...

iterations.description: No reproducible steps, VNC server details, or mRemoteNG version provided; the timeout could be caused by VNC server settings, network issues, or the VNC idle/screen-saver disconnect — need more details to diagnose

comments.author: cdusold
comments.snippet: Is there a version I can revert to to stop this from happening? This program is unusable like this.

notes:
AI triage: No reproducible steps, VNC server details, or mRemoteNG version provided; the timeout could be caused by VNC server settings, network issues, or the VNC idle/screen-saver disconnect — need more details to diagnose
Approach: If confirmed as an mRemoteNG bug, investigate whether the VNC protocol handler has a keepalive or reconnect mechanism and whether idle connections are being prematurely closed by the framebuffer update loop or a missing keepalive timer
